wikipedia_page.main: Evan Alcock Nepean (13 September 1865 – 20 January 1906) was an English first-class cricketer active 1886–1902 who played for Middlesex, Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) and Oxford University. He was born in Mitcham; died in Windsor.

response: Amongst Jenner-Fust's cricket-playing relatives are his brothers-in-law John, Percyvall and Thomas Dyke, his cousin Edwin, his father Herbert Jenner, his nephew Evan Nepean and his uncles Charles and Henry.

Nepean was born in Mayfair, London, the youngest of 13 children of Rev. Canon Evan Nepean (1800–1873) and Anne Fust. His father was the son of Sir Evan Nepean, 1st Baronet and was the Canon of Westminster and a Chaplain in Ordinary to Queen Victoria.
*Evan Nepean (1751–1822), British politician and colonial administrator
